page.title: 10A Farming Family.
page.content:
The Pashley family have farmed in the Kirk Bramwith area for 59yrs.The family consists of Mr.L.Pashley senior his son Alan,three grandsons and two great grandsons.They started with one horse and a plough and now farm 950 acres. 154 acres are for grazing, they have 137 cattle, Charolais, Limousin and Hereford,27 are for breeding and 110 for beef.Other land:
{Crop} {Acres} {Yield.} Wheat 360 3.5tons. Barley 182 3. tons. Beans 20 1. ton. Rape 34 1.5tons. Sugar beet 90 20 tons. Potatoes 50 20 tons. Silage 24 4 tons. Hay 20 4 tons. Employees in addition to family,1 plus casual labour at harvest time.
